message: What should I use? Script tags in the head and $(function(){ code }) or script tags at the end of the body?
Always load your script tags at the end of the body because they block rendering while loading and executing. Still use $(function(){}) at the bottom of the page too
Yeah, what @cvd said. Also, make sure that your scripts are external files and not inline.
Also, put all your code inside $(document).ready(function() { // code here }); so that it runs when the DOM is loaded and not before.
And why do I have to use $(){ code } when it is at the end of the body? I think the document is loaded when the engine reaches this part.

@linopolus The document code is loaded, however the DOM has not necessarily been constructed by that point, so if you plan on doing any DOM manipulation it's advisable to wait for the onDOMReady event. Other stuff can be done immediately, or hooked up to the onLoad event, which will fire as soon as the browser has finished reading.

actually it doesn't matter where you  put $(function () {}) since it only runs after the DOM is loaded. According to jquery documentation (http://api.jquery.com/ready/) $(document).ready(function () {}) is equivalent to $(function () {}). What you are referring to  is putting a (function () {}) () which declares a function then executes it. This can be affected by the DOM loading.
